alert.note: Alert for East Central Plains; Middle Rio Grande Valley; Northeast Highlands; Northeast Plains; Northwest Highlands; Northwest Plateau; Sandia Manzano And Gallinas Mountains; West Central Highlands (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued April 09 at 2:00AM MDT until April 11 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 8 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR ALL AREAS EXCEPT THE NORTH CENTRAL MOUNTAINS BELOW SNOWPACK FOR STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITIES AND AN UNSTABLE AIRMASS... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM TO 8 PM MDT SUNDAY FOR ALL AREAS EXCEPT THE NORTH CENTRAL MOUNTAINS BELOW SNOWPACK DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITIES AND AN UNSTABLE AIRMASS... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH MONDAY EVENING... .Strong westerly winds this afternoon will combine with single digit minimum relative humidities, well above normal to near record temperatures, and an unstable airmass to produce widespread critical fire weather conditions. Ridgetop winds will strengthen more tonight and combined with very poor humidity recoveries, localized critical conditions will persist through the overnight. Consequently, critical fire weather conditions ramp up rapidly Sunday over all but the North Central Mountains. An extended and widespread period of single digit humidities today will be focused over the Middle Rio Grande Valley, Northeast and East Central Plains Sunday. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 8 PM MDT THIS EVENING... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM TO 8 PM MDT SUNDAY... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH MONDAY EVENING... The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a Red Flag Warning...which is in effect from 10 AM to 8 PM MDT Sunday. A Fire Weather Watch has also been issued. This Fire Weather Watch is in effect from Monday afternoon through Monday evening. * AREA AND TIMING...All areas below snowpack except the North Central Mountains this afternoon and early evening. Strengthening ridgetop winds tonight combined with low humidities will result in localized critical conditions continuing during the overnight. Critical conditions rapidly become widespread Sunday morning and persist through early Sunday evening for all areas except the North Central Mountains below snowpack. Critical conditions return on Monday. * 20 FOOT WINDS...Southwest to west 20 to 30 mph with gusts of 40 to 45 mph this afternoon. Southwest to west 25 to 35 mph with gusts of 45 to 50 mph over ridgetops tonight and areawide on Sunday. Southwest 25 to 35 mph with gusts to around 50 mph Monday. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Ranging from about 4 to 8 percent this afternoon, about 6 to 12 percent Sunday and 7 to 13 percent Monday. Widespread 10 to 15 consecutive hours of single digit humidities today and 5 to 10 consecutive hours on Sunday focused over the Middle Rio Grande Valley, Northeast and East Central Plains. * IMPACTS....Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning. Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Fire Weather Watch.

area.areaDesc: East Central Plains; Middle Rio Grande Valley; Northeast Highlands; Northeast Plains; Northwest Highlands; Northwest Plateau; Sandia Manzano And Gallinas Mountains; West Central Highlands
